content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</origin> <pubdate>Unknown</pubdate> <pubtime>Unknown</pubtime> <title>Outer Continental Shelf 200 Nautical Mile Limit - Gulf of Mexico Region NAD27</title> <geoform>vector digital data</geoform> <onlink>http://www.data.boem.gov/homepg/pubinfo/repcat/arcinfo/zipped/csb.zip</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This data set contains Continental Shelf Boundary (CSB) lines in ESRI shapefile format for the BOEM Gulf of Mexico Region. The CSB defines the seaward limit of federally managed OCS lands. The line depicts the limit of U.S. jurisdiction for offshore mineral development. This CSB file only includes the lateral boundaries between the United States and Mexico, or Cuba. That portion of the CSB defined by the 200 nautical mile line is not yet included. The BOEM CSB line is similar to, the Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) line published by NOAA, but the CSB may have slight differences. For example the CSB line will include intersection points with the BOEM OCS blocks. Additional details are available from OCS Report MMS 99-0006 - Boundary Development on the Outer Continental Shelf: http://www.boem.gov/uploadedFiles/BOEM/Oil_and_Gas_Energy_Program/Mapping_and_Data/99-0006.pdfBecause GIS projection and topology functions can change or generalize coordinates, these GIS files are considered to be approximate and are NOT an OFFICIAL record for the exact baseline coordinates. The Official Protraction Diagrams (OPDs) and Supplemental Official Block Diagrams (SOBDs) serve as the legal definition for BOEM offshore boundary coordinates and area descriptions. Contains the continental shelf boundary as of March 15, 2013. Used ArcCatalog to create shape files. Shape files put at \\\\imsnolna04\\le\\shared\\GISPublicInfo.</abstract> <purpose> These baseline points and other cadastre information the BOEM produces are generated in accordance with 30 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 256.8 to support Federal land ownership and mineral resource management.   This is the continental shelf boundary from TIMS GOM as of March 15,2013 </purpose> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>unknown</caldate> <time>unknown</time> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>As needed</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-97.155212</westbc> <eastbc>-81.893723</eastbc> <northbc>30.218050</northbc> <southbc>25.773401</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>PI</themekey> <themekey>TIMS PI Dump</themekey> <themekey>Public Information</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>NGDA Portfolio Themes</themekt> <themekey>National Geospatial Data Asset</themekey> <themekey>NGDA</themekey> <themekey>Water Oceans and Coasts Theme</themekey> </theme> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>The data was developed within the U.S. Government; no proprietary rights may be attached to them nor may they be sold to the U.S. Government as part of any procurement of ADP products or services. This data is NOT to be used for any MAS products</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Gulf of Mexico OCS Region; Office of Leasing & Plans, Mapping & Automation Section</cntorg> <cntper>Technical Information Management System (TIMS), Mapping System</cntper> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Chief</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype> <address>1201 Elmwood Park Blvd., Room 271</address> <city>New Orleans</city> <state>LA</state> <postal>70123</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(504)731-1457</cntvoice> <cntfax>fax 504-736-2655</cntfax> <cntemail>leonard.coats@boem.gov</cntemail> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen>http://www.data.boem.gov/images_opt/graphics/gis/GOMR_Continental_Shelf_Bdry.png</browsen> <browsed>Image depicting the Gulf of Mexico Continental Shelf Boundary - as created by BOEM</browsed> </browse> <datacred> The data was developed within the U.S. Government; no proprietary rights may be attached to them nor may they be sold to the U.S. Government as part of any procurement of ADP products or services. 1866</ellips> <semiaxis>6378206.4</semiaxis> <denflat>294.9786982</denflat> </geodetic> </horizsys> </spref> <eainfo> <detailed> <enttyp> <enttypl>csb</enttypl> </enttyp> <attr> <attrlabl>OBJECTID</attrlabl> <attrdef>Internal feature number.</attrdef> <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>Shape</attrlabl> <attrdef>Feature geometry.</attrdef> <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Coordinates defining the features.</udom> </attrdomv> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>CSB_</attrlabl> <attrdef>Portion of Continental Shelf Boundary</attrdef> <attrdefs>BOEM</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>CSB_ID</attrlabl> <attrdef>ID related to portion of the boundary</attrdef> <attrdefs>BOEM</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>MMS_REGION</attrlabl> <attrdef>An unique identifier for the Minerals Management Service (MMS) Outer Continental Shelf</attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>BDRY_TYPE_</attrlabl> <attrdef>Identifies the type of offshore boundary line.</attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>BDRY_PT_PR</attrlabl> <attrdef> The identifier of an official protraction, which can be one of two types as utilized by the Minerals Management Service (MMS):  an Official Protraction Diagram (OPD) or Leasing Map.  Official Protraction Diagrams (OPD's) and Leasing Maps depict approved subdivisions (blocks) of the OCS intended for leasing purposes.  OPD's are constructed on the UTM Grid System and utilize the United Nations International Map of the World alpha- numeric numbering system.  This worldwide system consists of main blocks (or zones) subdivided into minor blocks, which correspond to individual OPD's.  Leasing Maps are the projection of a local (Lambert) State Plane Coordinate System Grid, onto the OCS.  This system was developed prior to the more recent mapping system, which is comprised of the OPD's.  Leasing Map coverage is limited to the near offshore areas of Louisiana, Texas, and southern California. </attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>BDRY_APRV_</attrlabl> <attrdef>The date the Official Protraction Diagram or Leasing Map is signed by the Federal Government and approved for distribution.</attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>BLOCK_NUMB</attrlabl> <attrdef> Identifies a subdivision of an Official Protraction Diagram.  An OCS block number is an unique and constant designation.  However, if changes occur to the map grid system and/or coastline, some blocks could become larger or smaller, or be created or deleted.  The total area in a block does not exceed 5,760 acres or 2,304 hectares. </attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>BDRY_NAME_</attrlabl> <attrdef>An indicator of the official name of a boundary.</attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>BDRY_NAME1</attrlabl> <attrdef>An indicator of the official name of a boundary.</attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>BDRY_COV_S</attrlabl> <attrdef>A sequence number associated with an offshore projected or nonprojected boundary segment.</attrdef> <attrdefs>DATA ELEMENTS \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd [DDELEMENT]</attrdefs> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>LEN</attrlabl> <attrdef>-</attrdef> </attr> <attr> <attrlabl>Shape_Length</attrlabl> <attrdef>Length of feature in internal units.</attrdef> <attrdefs>ESRI</attrdefs> <attrdomv> <udom>Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.</udom> </attrdomv> </attr> </detailed> </eainfo> <metainfo> <metd>20140915</metd> <metc> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>BOEM, Gulf of Mexico OCS Region, Office of Leasing, Mapping and Automation Section</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntpos>Chief Mapping and Automation Section</cntpos> <cntaddr> <addrtype>physical address</addrtype> <address>1201 Elmwood Park</address> <city>New Orleans</city> <state>LA</state> <postal>70123</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(504)731-1457</cntvoice> </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata</metstdn> <metstdv>FGDC-STD-001-1998</metstdv> <mettc>local time</mettc> <metuc>The data was developed within the U.S. Government; no proprietary rights may be attached to them nor may they be sold to the U.S. Government as part of any procurement of ADP products or services.</metuc> </metainfo> </metadata>
